TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SymmetricProofDescriptor extends System.IdentityModel.Tokens.ProofDescriptor

Docs.summary: This class can be used for issuing the symmetric key based token.

MemberSignature.Value: public SymmetricProofDescriptor (System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials targetWrappingCredentials);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials targetWrappingCredentials) cil managed

Docs.param: The to be used.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified encrypting credentials.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this constructor if you want the STS to use the specified <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials>.

MemberSignature.Value: public SymmetricProofDescriptor (byte[] key, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials targetWrappingCredentials);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(unsigned int8[] key, class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials targetWrappingCredentials) cil managed

Docs.param: The symmetric key that is used inside the issued token.
The key encrypting credentials for the relying party.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified key material.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this constructor if you want the STS to use the specified key bytes. This happens when client sends the entropy, and the STS would just use that as the key for the issued token.

MemberSignature.Value: public SymmetricProofDescriptor (int keySizeInBits, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials targetWrappingCredentials);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 keySizeInBits, class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials targetWrappingCredentials) cil managed

Docs.param: The size of the symmetric key.
The key encrypting credentials for the target of the request.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with an auto-generated key.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this constructor if you want the STS to auto-generate the key using a random number generator and send it in the proof token as a binary secret.

MemberSignature.Value: public SymmetricProofDescriptor (int keySizeInBits, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials targetWrappingCredentials, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials requestorWrappingCredentials);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 keySizeInBits, class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials targetWrappingCredentials, class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials requestorWrappingCredentials) cil managed

Docs.param: The size of the symmetric key.
The key encrypting credentials for the target of the request.
The key encrypting credentials for the requestor.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with an auto-generated key.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this constructor if you want the STS to auto-generate the key and send it in the proof token as encrypted key. Two cases can be covered by using this constructor:
1. The client sends the entropy, but the server rejects it.
2. The client does not send the entropy, so the server's entropy is used.

Docs.exception: is less than or equal to zero.

MemberSignature.Value: public SymmetricProofDescriptor (int keySizeInBits, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials targetWrappingCredentials, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials requestorWrappingCredentials, byte[] sourceEntropy);

Docs.param: The size of the symmetric key.
The key encrypting credentials for the target of the request.
The encrypting credentials for the requestor used to encrypt the entropy or the proof token.
The requestor's entropy.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class to use for sending combined entropy.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this constructor if you want to send a combined entropy.

MemberSignature.Value: public SymmetricProofDescriptor (int keySizeInBits, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials targetWrappingCredentials, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials requestorWrappingCredentials, string encryptWith);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 keySizeInBits, class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials targetWrappingCredentials, class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials requestorWrappingCredentials, string encryptWith) cil managed

Docs.param: The size of the symmetric key.
The key encrypting credentials for the relying party.
The key encrypting credentials for the requestor.
The algorithm (URI) specified in the element of the RST.
Docs.summary: Use this constructor to have the STS autogenerate a key and send it in the proof token as encrypted key. Two cases are covered here 1. client sends the entropy, but server rejects it 2. client did not send a entropy, so just use server's entropy

remarks.format:
## Remarks If `encryptWith` is a DES algorithm, the key is guaranteed not to be a weak DES key.
Use this constructor if you want the STS to auto-generate the key and send it in the proof token as encrypted key. Two cases can be covered by using this constructor:
1. The client sends the entropy, but the server rejects it.
2. The client does not send the entropy, so the server's entropy is used.

Docs.exception: is less than or equal to zero.

MemberSignature.Value: public SymmetricProofDescriptor (int keySizeInBits, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials targetWrappingCredentials, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials requestorWrappingCredentials, byte[] sourceEntropy, string encryptWith);

Docs.param: The size of the symmetric key.
The encrypting credentials for the relying party used to encrypt the key in the SecurityKeyIdentifier property.
The encrypting credentials for the requestor used to encrypt the entropy or the proof token.
The requestor's entropy.
The URI of the algorithm to use to encrypt the proof key.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class to use for sending combined entropy.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this constructor to send combined entropy.

Docs.exception: is less than or equal to zero.

Docs.param: The RSTR to which to apply the proof descriptor.
Docs.summary: Modifies the specified RSTR based on the settings in this proof descriptor.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Sets the appropriate artifacts, such as the requested proof token, inside the RSTR based on what is inside the proof descriptor instance.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier KeyIdentifier { get; }
.property instance class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier KeyIdentifier

Docs.summary: Gets the key identifier that can be used inside the issued token to define the key. It is usually the binary secret or the encrypted key;

MemberSignature.Value: protected System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials RequestorEncryptingCredentials { get; }
.property instance class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials RequestorEncryptingCredentials

Docs.summary: Gets the requestor's encrypting credentials, which may be used to encrypt the requested proof token or the entropy in the response.

MemberSignature.Value: protected System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials TargetEncryptingCredentials { get; }
.property instance class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials TargetEncryptingCredentials

Docs.summary: Gets the relying party encrypting credentials, which may be used to encrypt the requested security token in the response.
